Kira_Isabella:
{{+r|date=June 2024}} {{short description|Canadian country music singer}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Kira Isabella | image = Kira Isabella performed at Boots and Hearts 2013.jpg | caption = Kira Isabella performing at the Boots and Hearts Music Festival 2013 | image_size = | birth_name = Kira Isabella Wilkie | birth_place = [[Ottawa, Ontario]], Canada | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|9|18}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/kira-isabella-mn0002840698/discography|title = Kira Isabella Albums and Discography|website = [[AllMusic]]}} | origin = | instrument = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter | years_active = 2010–present | label = [[Sony Music]], Hitshop Records | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Kira Isabella Wilkie''' (born September 18, 1993) is a Canadian [[country music]] artist. Isabella was signed to [[Sony Music]] in 2009.{{cite web|title=Kira Isabella Biography|url=http://www.cmt.ca/artist/kira-isabella/|work=[[CMT (Canada)|CMT]]|accessdate=November 2, 2011}} Her first single, "Love Me Like That", was released in 2011 and charted on the [[Canadian Hot 100]]. Isabella released her second single in 2011 entitled "A Real Good Radio". Her third single, "[[A Little More Work]]", was released in 2012. Her debut studio album, ''[[Love Me Like That (album)|Love Me Like That]]'', was released in October 2012, and produced two further singles. Kira Isabella announced dates for a 2013 Canadian tour with [[Terri Clark]] in October 2012 and [[Carrie Underwood]] in December 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.kiraisabella.ca/ |title=The Official Kira Isabella Site |publisher=Kiraisabella.ca |date= |accessdate=2014-05-20}} In 2013, Isabella signed with U.S. record label HitShop Records.{{cite web|title=HitShop Records Signs Canadian Country Singer Kira Isabella|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/124514/hitshop-records-signs-canadian-country-singer-kira|work=All Access Music Group|accessdate=November 20, 2013}} The lead single from her second album, "[[Quarterback (song)|Quarterback]]", was released in spring 2014. ==Early life== Kira Isabella began singing and playing the guitar at 7 years old, under the tutelage of her father and her singing teacher Trina Langthorne. Her ethnic background is [[Colombians|Colombian]].{{Cite web |url=https://instagram.com/p/BdzqeoCFN0E/ |title=Instagram post by Jim • Jan 11, 2018 at 11:19am UTC, Kira Isabella commenting on her heritage |website=Instagram |language=en |access-date=2018-01-21}} She was inspired by fellow Canadian country singer [[Shania Twain]] and her then recent album, ''[[Up! (album)|Up!]]'', to enter the country music industry. Her songwriting began development through writing poetry, beginning in the fourth grade.{{cite web|url=http://torontowide.blogspot.ca/2012/08/in-conversation-kira-isabella.html |title=Torontowide: Kira Isabella: In Conversation |publisher=Torontowide.blogspot.ca |date= |accessdate=2014-05-20}} At the age of 14, Kira Isabella won the Rising Star Award in the Female Open Category of a Blyth, Ontario, arts festival. The consequential media exposure that led well-known music producers to Kira Isabella would help launch her career as a country singer.{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.ca/artist/kira-isabella/ |title=Kira Isabella | Biography, Videos, YouTube Videos, Music Downloads, Social Network Updates, And More |publisher=CMT.ca |date=2012-10-02 |accessdate=2014-05-20}} ==Influences== Female country singers such as [[Faith Hill]], [[Sheryl Crow]], [[Shania Twain]] and [[Taylor Swift]] have been cited by Kira Isabella as strong musical influences. ==Tours and festivals== To date, Kira Isabella has performed as a guest singer on two tours. From October to December 2012, she has worked with [[Carrie Underwood]] on her [[Blown Away Tour]] and in 2013, with [[Terri Clark]]. She will have performed in the [[Boots and Hearts Music Festival]] line-up for two years consecutively by August 2013. Her first headlining show was June 30, 2013 in Calabogie, Ontario at the Calabogie Country Music Fest. She also performed at the free biweekly Peterborough Musicfest on July 31, 2013.{{cite web |url=http://www.ptbomusicfest.ca/index.php?option=com_jtagcalendar&eventId=11 |title=Peterborough Musicfest |publisher=Ptbomusicfest.ca |date=2013-07-31 |accessdate=2014-05-20}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Love Me Like That (album)|Love Me Like That]]'' | * Release date: October 2, 2012 * Label: [[Sony Music Canada]] |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Caffeine & Big Dreams]]'' | * Release date: October 14, 2014 * Label: Sony Music Canada |- ! scope="row"| ''Sides'' | * Release date: March 15, 2019 * Label: Creator Brand |} ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''Side A'' | * Release date: November 23, 2018 * Label: Creator Brand |- ! scope="row"| ''Side B'' | * Release date: January 11, 2019 * Label: Creator Brand |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:1em;" | Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:15em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
